description.narrative: Parliament enabled to perform its core functions for improved legislation, participation, representation and accountability, as well as the promotion of good governance for improved lives of the people of Zimbabwe. The Project Objectives presented as outcomes were as follows: a) Outcome 1: New laws enacted, and old laws aligned with the Constitution. b) Outcome 2: Oversight function of Parliament strengthened; Governance systems enhanced. c) Outcome 3: People’s participation in legislation formulation, decision-making and related democratic processes increased. d) Outcome 4: Parliament’s performance of its core functions strengthened through capacitating Parliament leadership and staff. e) Outcome 5: Gender Mainstreamed in Parliament systems and processes.

Programmet "Multi-Donor Support Programme for the Parliament and the Office of the Auditor General of Zimbabwe, 2015-2017" avser stödja parlamentet att bli mer effektiva i att utföra sitt mandat och primära funktioner för att därigenom förbättra lagstiftning, representation och deltagande samt ansvarsutkrävande av landets regereing. Programmet omfattar även kapacitetsstöd till landets riksrevision i dess självständiga roll att till parlamentet rapportera om förvaltningen av offentliga resurser.
Programmets budget är ca 4,8 MUSD. EU avser bidra med 2,1 MUSD (1,8 MEURO) och UNDP med 1,0 MUSD. Sverige föreslås bidra med de återstående ca 1,7 MUSD.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

tag.narrative: 16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Examples of results acheived by the programme are: 1. New Laws enacted and old laws algined to the constitution: A cumulative of 246 laws out of a target of 296 (set in 2016) were aligned to the constitution during the implemantion period. Some key laws aligned to the Constitution, include the Electoral Amendment Act in May 2018 which improved the electoral legal framework. The Act introduced the Bio-metrical Voting Registration, the code of conduct for political parties and some gender considerations. Furthermore, the programme assisted in the enactment of laws aimed at contributing to political and economic governance and social development, with emphasis on social cohesion, peace and development and economic recovery. Some of the Bills passed into law are the National Peace and Reconciliation Commission Act 2018, the Electoral Amendment Act 2018, the Special Economic Zones Act the Public Entities, Corporate Governance Act, 2018, the Zimbabwe Investment Authority Act, the Companies and Deeds Act, the Public Finance Management Bill. Public Debt Management Act and Local Government Amendment Act, 2016 to mention but a few 2. Oversight function of Parliament strengthened; Governance systems enhanced.Improvements in the executive responsiveness to parliament oversight mandate through submission of quarterly statutory reports, from a baseline zero compliance in 2014 as outlined in the PSP document 2014 – 2017 were registered as a result of the programme support. 3. People’s participation in legislation formulation, decision-making and related democratic processes increased. The programme supported public hearings for most of the critical bills which passed through parliament and thereby contributing to public participation in democratic processes as per the Constitution Section 141 and various international human rights frameworks. Public inputs strengthened parliament portfolio committee’s reports tabled in parliament. 4. Parliament’s performance of its core functions strengthened through capacitating Parliament leadership and staff. Enhanced efficiency and effectiveness in the administration of parliament in servicing MPs and the public was archived, as exemplefied by the improved quality of committee reports , well-prepared and timely produced Hansard reports and improvements in organizational systems. 5. GenderThe programme has contributed to capacity building of women parliamentarians in gender mainstreaming and the development of the Zimbabwe Women‘s Parliamentary Caucus (ZWPC) strategic plan 2015 -2018. Examples of some results are:- the lobbying of provision and availability of sanitary wear.- A gender analysis of leglisation resulting in the inclusion of gender equality and parity clauses in these Acts. - The programme supported more than 70 female MPs with training on Information Communication Technology, leading to increased participated in debates by female MP.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
